title: Omelet Strips in Tomato Sauce
introduction: This delightful dish ensures you never miss pasta again. With a thin frittata cut into strips that resemble fettuccine, this Italian-inspired meal is both creative and delicious. Known as 'fettuccine di frittata' in Italy, it's also referred to as 'trippe finte' in Rome due to the egg strips' tripe-like appearance. Perfect for lunch or dinner, pair it with seasonal green vegetables or a fresh green salad for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 2 cups Fresh Tomato Sauce or Tuscan Tomato Sauce
1/4 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, plus more for serving
instructions: Prepare the tomato sauce, if necessary. Then, place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Generously butter a 13 × 9 × 2–inch baking dish.

In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, 1/4 cup of cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper to taste. Pour the egg mixture into the prepared pan. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until the eggs are just set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
Run a knife around the edge of the pan. Invert the eggs onto a cutting board. Cut the omelet into 1/2-inch strips.
In a 9-inch nonstick skillet, heat the sauce over low heat until simmering. Slip the egg strips into the sauce. Cook, stirring gently, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve hot with grated cheese.
